titleStmt.title: The Protestants evidence taken out of good records; shewing that for fifteene hundred yeares next after Christ, divers worthy guides of Gods Church, have in sundry weightie poynts of religion, taught as the Church of England now doth: distributed into severall centuries, and opened, by Simon Birckbek ...
titleStmt.author: Birckbek, Simon, 1584-1656.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Augustine Mathewes and Thomas Cotes] for Robert Milbourne, and are to bee sold at the signe of the Grayhound in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Title page in red and black.
"The tvvelfth centurie, from the yeere one thousand one hundred, to one thousand two hundred" (caption title) has separate pagination and register.
Page c4r has errata. Variant: c4r blank.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the Grayhound in Pauls Church-yard
